snippet: A former head of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said he was ousted more than a decade ago because of pressure from the Bush administration over inspections in Iraq.
abstract: Jose Bustani, former director general of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons in the Hague, says he was ousted from position in 2002 because of Bush administration's fear that chemical weapons inspections in Iraq would conflict with Washington’s rationale for invading country; Bustani has come forward as agency has been thrust into spotlight after having been awarded Nobel Peace Prize.
lead_paragraph: A former head of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said he was ousted more than a decade ago because of pressure from the Bush administration over inspections in Iraq.

headline.main: To Ousted Boss, Arms Watchdog Was Seen as an Obstacle in Iraq
headline.print_headline: To Ousted Boss, Arms Watchdog Was Seen as an Obstacle in Iraq

keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
keywords.name: organizations
